meanings.definition: The growth of one substance into another.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the intergrowths of crystals under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The geologist found interesting intergrowths of minerals in the rock formation.
meanings.sent3: The intergrowths of chocolate and nuts in the dessert made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The intergrowths of vines in the jungle created a dense and tangled environment.
meanings.sent5: The intergrowths of roots in the soil formed a complex network underground.

meanings.definition: The intertwining growth of two or more substances.
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting depicted beautiful intergrowths of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent2: The botanist observed the intricate intergrowths of plant roots in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The intergrowths of yarn in the knitting project created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The intergrowths of branches in the forest canopy created a natural tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The intergrowths of flavors in the dish blended harmoniously on the palate.
